sense.name: the act of exposing an underlying structure by digging
sense.examples: Careful excavation of the dinosaur bones is required to avoid damaging them. The excavation of this newly discovered Greek temple will take many years.

sense.name: an archeological or paleontological site
sense.examples: We visited an archeological excavation in southern Mexico. These early partial excavations date back to the 18th century.

sense.name: a large hole in the ground
sense.examples: The excavation for the new skyscraper extends hundreds of feet into the ground.

sense.name: activity of extracting ore or other matter from the ground
sense.examples: New techniques of coal excavation are more environmentally sound than earlier ones. The excavation of the new building complex has not yet begun.
